title: Establishing the United States Council on Transnational Organized Crime

enrichment.summary: This executive order creates a new United States Council on Transnational Organized Crime to coordinate and strengthen government efforts against international criminal networks that threaten public safety, national security, and the economy. It directs key agencies to collaborate, share intelligence, develop strategic plans, and enhance tools to disrupt and dismantle these criminal organizations.
potential_concerns: Enhanced intelligence-sharing and interagency coordination could lead to increased surveillance and potential civil rights infringements affecting undocumented immigrants and refugees.
Efforts to disrupt transnational crime networks may inadvertently harm human trafficking victims by complicating victim identification and support processes.
Border communities may face intensified law enforcement presence and operations, potentially impacting local residents and cultural dynamics adversely.

The orderâ€™s emphasis on targeting criminal organizations using violence and corruption could risk reinforcing racial and ethnic profiling, disproportionately affecting minority groups including transgender individuals.
Foreign governments cooperating under this order might experience diplomatic strain if U.S. actions are perceived as overreach or interference in their domestic affairs.
